Content:: The following is a timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in Malaysia during 2022. On 9 February, former Malaysian Prime Minister Muhyiddin Yassin tested positive for COVID-19.[60] On 13 February, the total number of cases in Malaysia exceeded the 3 million mark, reaching 3,040,235.[44] By 24 February, the total number of recoveries in Malaysia had exceeded the 3 million mark, reaching 3,018,172.[55] By 24 February, the number of cases among children below the age of 11 had risen from 2,492 cases on 13 February to 3,863 on 25 February. In addition, cases among adolescents aged 12 to 17 rose from 1,496 on 13 February to 1,849 on 25 February. Similarly, cases among adults aged between 18 and 59 years rose from 12,634 on 13 February to 20,771 on 25 February. Likewise, cases among senior citizens (aged 60 years and above) rose from 1,334 on 13 February to 2,261 on 25 February.[61] On 21 March, the total number of cases exceeded the 4 million mark, reaching 4,010,952.[82] On 3 April, the total number of recoveries exceeded the 4 million threshold, reaching 4,018,421.[95]
Title: Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in Malaysia (2022) - Wikipedia
